alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 12:10PM AKDT until July 27 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Coastal Flood Advisory, which is in effect from 10 PM this evening to noon AKDT Wednesday. The High Surf Advisory has been cancelled. * LOCATION...Point Romanof to Shaktoolik. * COASTAL FLOODING...Sea levels will rise 6 to 8 feet above the normal high tides. Strong southwest winds of 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 65 mph will push surge and waves up the beach and up riverbanks much further than normal. * TIMING...Late this evening through Noon Wednesday. The highest water levels are expected between 6 AM and 10 AM AKDT Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Storm surge and wave run-up will push water up the beach and up riverbanks much further than normal. Objects left on the beach could be washed away. Minor beach erosion will occur.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills
